title: Signing on for Duty
description: A comprehensive module covering all aspects of signing on for duty including safety critical licenses, publications, notices, readiness statements, and equipment requirements.

flashcards.question: What action would you take if you forget or lose your safety critical license?
flashcards.answer: Report it to your SPM (Safety Performance Manager) and request a temporary paper copy of your license.

flashcards.question: What does the statement for readiness for duty include regarding drugs and alcohol?
flashcards.answer: That you are in compliance with the Drugs & Alcohol policy and, to the best of your knowledge, you are fit to drive trains.

flashcards.question: What must you have in your possession or have access to before signing on for duty?
flashcards.answer: All relevant publications, licenses, equipment and operating notices which you require during your turn of duty.

flashcards.question: What is the requirement regarding corrective glasses when signing on for duty?
flashcards.answer: If you wear corrective glasses, you must have two pairs in your possession (where required), unless you have written authorization stating otherwise.

flashcards.question: What must be done regarding notices pertinent to your turn of duty?
flashcards.answer: You must have read any notices pertinent to your turn of duty before signing on.

flashcards.question: What is the full criteria for meeting the readiness for duty statement?
flashcards.answer: 1. Compliance with Drugs & Alcohol policy and fit to drive trains. 2. In full uniform provided. 3. Possession of or access to all relevant publications, licenses, equipment and operating notices. 4. Have read all notices pertinent to your turn of duty. 5. If wearing corrective glasses, having two pairs (where required) unless written authorization states otherwise.

flashcards.question: What would you do if you discovered your safety critical license had expired?
flashcards.answer: Report it immediately to your SPM (Safety Performance Manager) as you would not be authorized to sign on for duty. Do not attempt to perform safety critical duties with an expired license.

flashcards.question: If during your pre-sign on checks you discover that a relevant notice case is empty, what should you do?
flashcards.answer: Report it to your supervisor immediately and ensure you obtain the necessary notices before signing on for duty, as having reviewed all pertinent notices is part of the readiness statement.

flashcards.question: What would you do if you arrived for work and felt unwell, but not severely ill?
flashcards.answer: You should not sign the readiness for duty statement if you don't feel fit to drive trains. Report to your supervisor that you don't feel fit for duty as per the readiness statement requirements.

flashcards.question: If you lose your safety critical license during your shift, what immediate action should you take?
flashcards.answer: Report it immediately to your SPM or supervisor as soon as you discover it missing. Continue your duties only if authorized to do so with a temporary paper copy of your license.

quiz.question: What action would you take if you forget or lose your safety critical license?
options: Continue your duties but inform your supervisor at the end of your shift
Report it to your SPM and request a temporary paper copy of your license
Borrow a license from a colleague for the duration of your shift
Sign on for duty but make a note in the occurrence book

quiz.question: According to the readiness for duty statement, what is required regarding your uniform?
options: You must ensure your uniform is clean and presentable
You must wear the company logo at all times
You must be in full uniform provided
You must wear your name badge visibly at all times

quiz.question: If you wear corrective glasses, how many pairs must you have in your possession?
options: One pair is sufficient
Two pairs are required (where required)
One pair plus contact lenses as backup
Three pairs - one for reading, one for distance, and one spare

quiz.question: What is an exception to the requirement for two pairs of corrective glasses?
options: If you've never had an incident related to broken glasses
If you have been employed for more than 5 years
If you have written authorization
If you also carry contact lenses as backup

quiz.question: Scenario: You arrive for your shift and realize you've forgotten your safety critical license at home, which is a 30-minute drive away. Your shift starts in 15 minutes. What is the correct course of action?
options: Ask a colleague to cover the first hour of your shift while you retrieve your license
Sign on for duty but make a note that your license was forgotten
Report it to your SPM and request a temporary paper copy of your license
Call in sick and use a personal day

quiz.question: Scenario: During your pre-sign on checks, you notice that the operating notices for your route haven't been updated for two days. What should you do?
options: Sign on for duty as normal since you're familiar with the route
Check with control or your supervisor to confirm if there are any new notices
Use the previous notices as they're likely still valid
Skip reading the notices this once since they're outdated

quiz.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned in the readiness for duty statement?
options: Compliance with Drugs & Alcohol policy
Having had adequate rest before your shift
Being in full uniform provided
Having read notices pertinent to your turn of duty

quiz.question: Scenario: You arrive for your shift wearing your prescribed glasses. Your second pair broke yesterday, and you haven't had time to get a replacement. What should you do?
options: Sign on for duty but take extra care with your remaining pair
Report the situation to your supervisor and follow their guidance
Sign on for duty but make a note about the broken glasses
Proceed as normal since one pair is sufficient for today's duties

quiz.question: What is a primary reason for checking notices cases before signing on for duty?
options: To ensure other staff members have signed on correctly
To log your arrival time in the system
To familiarize yourself with any changes or special instructions for your duty
To verify your roster details for the upcoming week

quiz.question: Scenario: You're about to sign on for duty, but you notice that your safety critical license expires today. What is the correct action?
options: Sign on for duty as the license is still valid today
Check with your supervisor to see if you can get an emergency extension
Refuse to sign on and request immediate license renewal
Report to your SPM to check if renewal has been processed and follow their guidance

quiz.question: Scenario: You took medication for a cold last night that states 'may cause drowsiness' but you feel fine this morning. According to the readiness for duty statement, what should you do?
options: Sign on for duty but avoid complex tasks if possible
Sign on for duty as normal since you feel fine
Consult with occupational health before signing on for duty
Declare it to your supervisor and follow company medication policy

quiz.question: Which of the following checks must be completed before signing on for duty?
options: Checking relevant publications, notices cases, and personal equipment
Checking weather conditions, track status, and passenger numbers
Checking your upcoming schedule, meal breaks, and end time
Checking email communications, company announcements, and team briefings

true-false.statement: If you forget your safety critical license, you should finish your shift and report it at the end of the day.
true-false.explanation: This is false. If you forget or lose your safety critical license, you must report it to your SPM and request a temporary paper copy of your license immediately. You cannot perform safety critical duties without proper authorization.

true-false.statement: The readiness for duty statement requires you to be in full uniform provided.
true-false.explanation: This is true. The readiness for duty statement explicitly requires that you are in full uniform provided by the company.

true-false.statement: If you wear corrective glasses, you only need to carry one pair with you during your duty.
true-false.explanation: This is false. If you wear corrective glasses, unless in possession of written authorization, you must have two pairs in your possession (where required).

true-false.statement: You must read all notices pertinent to your turn of duty before signing on.
true-false.explanation: This is true. The readiness for duty statement specifies that you must have read any notices pertinent to your turn of duty before signing on.

true-false.statement: Checking relevant publications is a required part of the sign-on process.
true-false.explanation: This is true. Checking relevant publications is one of the necessary checks that must be performed before signing on for duty.

true-false.statement: You can sign on for duty if you have consumed alcohol, as long as you feel fit to drive trains.
true-false.explanation: This is false. The readiness for duty statement requires compliance with the Drugs & Alcohol policy. Feeling fit to drive is not sufficient if you have consumed alcohol in violation of the policy.

true-false.statement: Scenario: You've taken medication that may cause drowsiness but don't feel drowsy. You can sign on for duty without informing anyone.
true-false.explanation: This is false. If you've taken medication that may impair your ability to safely perform your duties, you must follow the company's medication policy and inform your supervisor, even if you don't feel impaired. The readiness statement requires you to be fit for duty.

true-false.statement: Scenario: If notice cases haven't been updated recently, you can sign on without checking them if you're familiar with the route.
true-false.explanation: This is false. You must check notices cases regardless of route familiarity, and if they haven't been updated, you should verify with control or a supervisor if there are any new notices before signing on.

true-false.statement: Having access to all relevant publications is acceptable even if you don't physically possess them.
true-false.explanation: This is true. The readiness statement specifies that you must 'have in your possession or have access to all relevant publications, licenses, equipment and operating notices' which you require during your turn of duty.

true-false.statement: Scenario: Your safety critical license expires tomorrow. You can sign on for today's shift without any special action.
true-false.explanation: This is true. If your license expires tomorrow, it is still valid for today's shift. However, you should follow company procedure to ensure timely renewal for future shifts.

true-false.statement: If you feel unwell but can still function, you should sign on for duty and just take it easy during your shift.
true-false.explanation: This is false. The readiness statement requires that 'to the best of your knowledge, you are fit to drive trains.' If you feel unwell enough to question your fitness, you should not sign the readiness statement and should report to your supervisor.

true-false.statement: Scenario: You've arrived at work and realize you're missing a required piece of personal equipment. You can sign on if you borrow it from a colleague.
true-false.explanation: This is true, but with caution. The readiness statement requires you to have all necessary equipment, but doesn't specify it must be your own. However, ensure the borrowed equipment is appropriate and compliant with company policies.

true-false.statement: The readiness for duty statement includes confirmation that you've had adequate rest before your shift.
true-false.explanation: This is false. While being well-rested is important for safety, the specific readiness statement provided does not explicitly mention adequate rest as one of its requirements.

true-false.statement: Scenario: If you've been diagnosed with a medical condition that might affect your ability to drive trains, but you feel fine today, you can sign on without notifying anyone.
true-false.explanation: This is false. Any medical condition that might affect your ability to safely perform duties must be reported as per company medical policies. The readiness statement requires you to be fit for duty, which includes medical fitness.

true-false.statement: Once you've signed on for duty, you cannot be questioned about your readiness during your shift.
true-false.explanation: This is false. Your fitness and readiness for duty can be assessed at any time during your shift. If circumstances change affecting your readiness, you have a duty to report it.

true-false.statement: Scenario: Your SPM has issued you a temporary paper license. You must get your original license replaced within 24 hours.
true-false.explanation: This is false. While you should replace your license promptly, the scenario doesn't specify a 24-hour requirement for replacement. You should follow company procedures for license replacement, which may have different timeframes.

true-false.statement: Checking notices cases is primarily to verify your roster details.
true-false.explanation: This is false. Checking notices cases is to ensure you're aware of any operational changes, safety alerts, or special instructions relevant to your duties, not to verify roster details.

true-false.statement: The readiness for duty statement confirms you're compliant with all five specified criteria simultaneously.
true-false.explanation: This is true. The readiness statement confirms compliance with all criteria: Drugs & Alcohol policy compliance, fitness to drive, proper uniform, possession of/access to required publications/licenses/equipment/notices, reading pertinent notices, and having two pairs of corrective glasses if required (unless authorized otherwise).

true-false.statement: Scenario: You forgot your safety critical license but have a clear photo of it on your phone. This is an acceptable alternative to requesting a temporary paper copy.
true-false.explanation: This is false. A photo of your license on your phone is not an official document and is not a recognized alternative to having your physical license or an official temporary paper copy issued by your SPM.

true-false.statement: Personal equipment checks are optional if you're performing the same duties as your previous shift.
true-false.explanation: This is false. Personal equipment checks are mandatory before signing on for duty, regardless of whether you're performing the same duties as a previous shift.
